title: Watch: Republican congressmen rush to defend Donald Trump
description: Republican lawmakers express their views on the indictment of former President Donald Trump. CNN's Maju Raju reports from Capitol Hill.

title: Kremlin sharpens confrontation with Washington by arresting American journalist
description: American journalist Evan Gershkovich made a pointed observation last year following the arrest of prominent Russian opposition figure Ilya Yashin.

title: Dominion defamation case against Fox News will go to trial next month, judge rules
description: Dominion Voting Systems' historic defamation case against Fox News will proceed to a high-stakes jury trial next month, a Delaware judge ruled Friday, declining to declare a pretrial winner.

title: Their faces were disfigured by the war. Now these doctors are giving them back hope
description: A group of American and Canadian surgeons called "Face the Future" work across the globe focusing on delicate reconstructive surgery. The foundation's work included Russia, until recently, but they quickly pivoted their efforts to Ukraine after the full-scale war began. CNN's David McKenzie has the story.

title: Andrew Tate and brother to be moved from jail to house arrest as Romanian crime probe continues
description: Andrew Tate, the controversial former kickboxer turned social media influencer, and his brother Tristan will be moved out of jail and placed under house arrest in Romania, amid an ongoing criminal probe into allegations of organized crime, human trafficking and rape.

title: 5-year-old makes over $3,000 purchase on her mom's Amazon account
description: Five-year-old Lila Varisco was playing on her mom's phone during a car ride and spent over $3,000 on her mom's Amazon account. The order included 10 motorcycles and 10 pairs of cowgirl boots. CNN affiliate WJAR has more.

title: The Tesla Semi is getting recalled for faulty parking brakes
description: Tesla has issued a recall for 35 of its new electric Semi trucks because the parking brake might not engage when applied by the driver.

title: How these mice navigating a virtual reality game may help Alzheimer's patients
description: Researchers in New York developed a virtual reality maze for mice in an attempt to demystify a question that's been plaguing neuroscientists for decades: How are long-term memories stored?

title: King Charles wraps up triumphant state visit to Germany
description: Another week, another royal trip. This week, we joined King Charles and Queen Consort Camilla as they embarked on their historic first joint state visit abroad.

title: Late night shows react to Donald Trump's indictment
description: Jimmy Fallon, Stephen Colbert, Jimmy Kimmel and "Daily Show" guest host John Leguizamo reacted to the news that former President Donald Trump has been indicted by a Manhattan grand jury.

title: Palestinian taxi driver recounts surviving attack by right-wing protesters
description: A Palestinian taxi driver describes surviving a violent attack by a right-wing mob in Jerusalem earlier this week as Israel continues to see protests against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's judicial overhaul spread. CNN's Nic Robertson reports.

title: SE Cupp: No one should care about GOP outrage over Trump indictment
description: CNN's Jessica Dean sits with SE Cupp to discuss why a number of congressional Republicans have rallied to Trump's defense and are outraged over his indictment.

title: A 106-year-old from the Philippines is Vogue's oldest ever cover model
description: Vogue Philippines has revealed Apo Whang-Od as the cover star of its April issue, a move that makes the 106-year-old tattoo artist from the Philippines the oldest person ever to appear on the front of Vogue.

title: Syrian children traumatized by war are listening to a special lullaby to fall asleep
description: Syrian radio stations are broadcasting a new kind of lullaby every evening to help traumatized children across the country fall asleep.

title: Captive orca Lolita set for release into 'home waters' after 50 years at Miami Seaquarium
description: The killer whale known as Lolita appears one step closer to returning to its natural habitat of the Pacific Northwest, after performing at a Miami tourist attraction for decades.

title: NATO bans TikTok on devices
description: NATO has officially banned staffers from downloading the social media app TikTok onto their NATO-provided devices, citing security concerns, according to two NATO officials familiar with the matter.

title: China and Saudi Arabia are getting closer. Should the US be worried?
description: Saudi Arabia this week moved closer to joining a China-led Asian security and economic bloc, having been granted the status of a dialogue partner in the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) as it expands its global outreach.

title: Gwyneth Paltrow said this to Terry Sanderson after she won court case
description: Terry Sanderson was "very disappointed" by losing his lawsuit against Gwyneth Paltrow, but it appears things have ended between the two of them on good terms.

title: A Wagner soldier returned home after fighting for Russia. Days later he was a murder suspect
description: A convicted murderer who was allowed to leave prison in Russia to join the Wagner private military company and fight in Ukraine was arrested within days of returning home on suspicion of killing an elderly woman.

title: A snowboarder got buried upside down in snow. See skier's quick reaction.
description: Skier Francis Zuber sprang into action when he noticed a snowboarder had become trapped upside down in a tree well. Zuber, whose reaction has been applauded as a textbook example of what to do in such a situation, urged others to take up rescue courses.

title: Key inflation gauge in Europe hits record high even as overall price rises slow sharply
description: Inflation in Europe has fallen to its slowest pace in more than a year, though stark signs of persistent underlying pressure on prices will complicate policymakers' next move on borrowing costs.

title: This Transgender Day of Visibility is more important than ever
description: It's not enough to love our trans family and friends behind closed doors.

title: Can Trump still run for president in 2024?
description: Former President Donald Trump's indictment by a New York grand jury has thrust the nation into uncharted political, legal and historical waters, and raised a slew of questions about how the criminal case will unfold.

title: Breaking down Trump's 'Soros' attack on the Manhattan DA
description: In the wake of a Manhattan grand jury's historic decision to indict Donald Trump, the former president and some other prominent Republicans, including Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis and former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, have invoked liberal billionaire George Soros in their attacks on Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg. Trump claimed in a statement that Bragg was "hand-picked and funded by George Soros."

title: 'He's ready to fight': Trump lawyer reacts to indictment
description: Joe Tacopina, a defense lawyer for Donald Trump, reacted to the indictment of the former president and said his client was 'shocked' and is 'ready to fight'. CNN's Paula Reid has has the details.

title: More than 75 million under severe storm threat with possible tornadoes, hail and strong winds on the way
description: Severe storms are expected to sweep across some central and southern states beginning Friday afternoon, bringing the threat of several strong tornadoes, large hail and damaging winds to more than 75 million people.

title: First on CNN: CDC team studying health impacts of Ohio train derailment fell ill during investigation
description: Seven US government investigators briefly fell ill in early March while studying the possible health impacts of a toxic train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention confirmed to CNN on Thursday.

title: Wimbledon to allow Russian and Belarusian players to compete this year
description: Wimbledon will accept entries from Russian and Belarusian players for this year's tournament if they agree to compete as neutral athletes and comply with "appropriate conditions," organizers announced Friday in a statement.

title: First funeral connected to Nashville school shooting is set for today, as police release terrifying 911 calls of attack
Australian surf swim club members shocked by ban on nudity in changing rooms and showers
description: An Australian surf lifesaving club has found itself at the center of a controversy following its implementation of a no-nudity policy in showers and changing rooms.

title: Pope to be discharged from hospital on Saturday, Vatican says
description: Pope Francis is expected to be discharged from hospital on Saturday, Vatican spokesman Matteo Bruni said Friday in a statement.

title: Who will end up paying for the banking crisis: You
description: It cost the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation about $23 billion to clean up the mess that Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank left in the wake of their collapses earlier this month.

title: CNN Hero of the Year Nelly Cheboi returned to Kenya with plans to lift more students out of poverty
description: Just weeks after being named the 2022 CNN Hero of the Year, Nelly Cheboi traveled more than 7,000 miles to bring her award home. Far from the lights, cameras, and celebrities who surrounded her at the gala event in New York City, Cheboi was greeted by her own heroes: the students she serves in rural Mogotio, Kenya.

title: Women's Final Four: Everything you need to know
description: The women's NCAA tournament has reached the Final Four with some huge match-ups set to determine who plays in Sunday's championship game.

title: 8 Mexican ruins you can have to yourself
description: You join a long line at the ticket turnstile, run the gauntlet past aggressive souvenir vendors, then emerge into a clearing to see ... thousands of other tourists gathered around the Mexican ruins.

title: Post-2008 reforms didn't solve the problem of 'too big to fail' banks
description: Regulation introduced after the 2008 financial crisis was supposed to make bank bailouts a thing of the past. But its biggest test so far has revealed some serious shortcomings.

title: Crews work around the clock to put out blaze after train carrying highly flammable ethanol derailed in Minnesota
description: Nearly a day after a train carrying a highly flammable chemical derailed and burst into flames in a small city in southwestern Minnesota, crews were still working overnight to extinguish the flames as officials reassure residents the groundwater and air are safe.

title: Trump faces more than 30 counts related to business fraud, sources tell CNN. He's the first former US president to be criminally charged.
DONALD TRUMP INDICTED
Reeva Steenkamp's parents oppose early release for Oscar Pistorius as hearing starts
description: South Africa's parole board is hearing early release submissions Friday for disgraced Paralympian Oscar Pistorius, who was jailed for shooting dead his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp.

title: Japan joins the US and Europe in chipmaking curbs on China
description: Japan will restrict the overseas sale of chip manufacturing equipment, joining the United States and the Netherlands in curbing the export of key technology to China.

title: Why is Sweden afraid of publishing this book on race?
description: When mirrors show us how we look, we adjust what needs to be fixed. We don't break those mirrors simply because we won't accept our reflection.

title: After setting home run record last season, Aaron Judge opens new season where he left off
description: Aaron Judge smashing the ball into the stands has become a regular sight for baseball fans. And on the opening day of the new season, he treated fans to another explosive display.

title: New details about 2017 Las Vegas mass shooter revealed in hundreds of of FBI documents
description: A cache of newly released FBI documents reveals Stephen Paddock, the gambler who carried out the deadliest mass shooting in modern US history in Las Vegas in 2017, may have harbored resentment over how he and other high rollers were treated by casinos.

title: Colorado Rockies pitcher Daniel Bard to start season on injury list due to anxiety issues
description: Colorado Rockies closer Daniel Bard will start the season on the 15-day injury list (IL), citing anxiety issues, the team announced on Thursday.

title: Singapore Changi: The 'world's best airport' experiencing tech issues and delays
description: Singapore's Changi is often hailed as the world's best airport and is considered "a destination in itself," but that reputation is at risk as the city-state's border control authority warned of delays and long queues due to a technical issue with its immigration systems on Friday, March 31.

title: Alabama men's basketball star Brandon Miller declares for NBA Draft, per reports
description: University of Alabama men's basketball star Brandon Miller has declared for the 2023 NBA Draft, according to ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski.

title: Dior's landmark Mumbai show signals India's growing luxury status
description: Dior hosted a landmark runway show in Mumbai on Thursday, a move nodding both to India's long-standing role in manufacturing European high fashion and the growing power of its luxury consumers.

title: 'We will never forgive': Zelensky marks one year since the liberation of Bucha
description:
• How a team of surgeons try to repair faces shattered by war in Ukraine
• Finland's NATO bid clears last major hurdle

title: 'I'm ready to get back': Afrobeats superstar Davido drops new album 'Timeless'
description: In November 2022, Afrobeats superstar David Adeleke, better known as Davido, took a break from public life to deal with the tragic loss of his three-year-old son, Ifeanyi.

title: China's services activity jumps to decade high as economic recovery gets back on track
description: A key index measuring the strength of China's massive services sector jumped to its highest level in more than a decade, as the country's economic recovery gained traction.

title: Artists Gilbert & George open their own gallery, saying museums 'are too full up'
description: Famed artist duo Gilbert & George, who describe themselves as two men who are together one artist, have unveiled a new gallery in London dedicated to their work.

title: Thai firefighters battle huge forest blaze that spread across two mountains
description: Firefighters in central Thailand have spent days battling a wildfire that has engulfed two mountains and part of a forest park.

title: Trump has been indicted. Here's what happens next in court
description: A Manhattan grand jury's indictment of former President Donald Trump will set in motion a criminal process that will in some ways work like that of any other defendant, and in other ways, look very different.

title: First funeral connected to Nashville school shooting is set for today, as police release terrifying 911 calls of attack
description: The first funeral connected to this week's massacre of three children and three adults at a private Christian school in Nashville is set for Friday, a day after officials released distressing 911 calls reporting the shooting in the Tennessee city.

title: Russia is set to lead the UN Security Council as shelling in Ukraine continues
Chinese cities are so broke, they're cutting medical benefits for seniors
description: China's government, strapped for cash after years of enforcing a costly zero-Covid policy, is cutting medical benefits and planning to raise the retirement age, in deeply unpopular moves that are fueling widespread public anger.

title: Analysis: Trump's criminal indictment unleashes a bitter new phase in American politics
description: The first-ever criminal indictment of a former American president creates a uniquely perilous moment for a polarized republic already repeatedly driven to the brink by the endless norm-busting of Donald Trump.

title: How a team of US and Canadian surgeons try to repair faces shattered by war in Ukraine
description: Lesya Belinska is proud of her son. She stands next to Roman Belinsky at her home and hugs him with one arm. Belinsky waves her away, embarrassed.

title: Lizzo's brand Yitty launches gender-affirming shapewear
description: It is no secret that Lizzo is a passionate advocate for self-love. Alongside her confidence-boosting music — which includes tracks "Good as Hell," "2 Be Loved (Am I Ready)" and the Grammy-Award winning "About Damn Time" — the singer launched shapewear brand Yitty in 2022 with a goal of helping women of all body types "feel unapologetically good about themselves."

title: Michael Cohen on how he thinks Trump is handling indictment
description: Michael Cohen, the former personal attorney to former President Donald Trump, joins CNN's Don Lemon and Alisyn Camerota to discuss the former president's indictment by a New York grand jury.

title: Why 2023 is the year to visit Mongolia
description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

title: White House 'deeply concerned' over arrest of US journalist in Russia
description: CNN's Matthew Chance reports on Russian authorities detaining an American reporter from the Wall Street Journal and accused him of spying.

title: Fmr. prosecutor explains the long road between indictment and prison
description: Former prosecutor and CNN senior legal analyst Elie Honig explains why there is no such thing as a slam dunk criminal case against former President Donald Trump.
